title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 253.17 - Hearings; variance between pleadings and proof
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 253.17 - Hearings; variance between pleadings and proof

State Regulations
A variance between an allegation in a petition under
section 705 or a pleading in a proceeding under section 706, and the proof, is
not material unless it is so substantial as prejudicially to mislead the board
or any party. If a variance is not material, the hearing officer may admit such
proof and the facts may be found accordingly. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
253.17

Renumbered from 253.43

New

York State Register February 15, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 07, eff. 2/15/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
